issues.description: The problem statementâ€™s UML and task descriptions refer to a method printFarmSong(), but both the template and solution implement this functionality as singFarmSong(). This naming mismatch between the instructions and the code stub creates cognitive mapping confusion: students will look for printFarmSong() in Farm.java but find only singFarmSong().
issues.suggested_fix: Either rename singFarmSong() in the template and solution to printFarmSong(), or update the problem statement and UML to consistently use singFarmSong() across all artifacts.
